item.title: Australia's crumbling childcare safeguards put kids at risk. How can parents make sure they are safe?
item.description: The scale of Australia's childcare crisis is deeply distressing for parents. These are the simple questions to ask any childcare provider to know if your child is safe.

item.title: Environmental watchdog drops charges against company responsible for burning Kealba landfill fire
item.description: A company responsible for a tip that has been on fire for nearly six years may be allowed to keep its landfill licence, the ABC can reveal.

item.title: Arnold Schwarzenegger accuses US states of trying to 'out-cheat' each other under Trump
item.description: Former California governor Arnold Schwarzenegger has expressed concern over the "crazy gerrymandering" that is taking place across the US.

item.title: Why Cam Green staying at No.3 could help get the best out of Steve Smith during the 2025/26 Ashes
item.description: With Cam Green and Steve Smith shaping as the mostly likely candidates to be selected as Australia's No.3 for this summer's Ashes, selectors face a choice between pragmatism and tradition.

item.title: Man accused of lighting Mount Gambier Valley Lake bushfire while wearing mask and cape denied bail
item.description: Police allege a 37-year-old man lit six fires at Valley Lake, near Mount Gambier, at night while wearing a silver cape and a black mask, after allegedly stealing a cask of wine from a liquor store.

item.title: Joshua Berrigan sentenced to 10 years' jail for fatal one-punch attack on Nathan McPherson
item.description: The family of a 43-year-old one-punch attack victim told his killer their lives "have been shattered beyond recognition" during an emotional Queensland court hearing.

item.title: Man charged after Darwin priest stabbed in face with pen while setting up for mass
item.description: Police charge a 38-year-old man who allegedly stabbed a Darwin priest in the face with a pen while he was setting up for evening mass.

item.title: Police scale back search for man missing in waters off Mornington
item.description: The family of a man who was on a small boat that capsized on Friday night say they are mourning the loss of their uncle, brother and friend, as police scale back their search.

item.title: Argentina's Javier Milei wins in decisive midterms as Trump loan looms large
item.description: Argentina's libertarian President Javier Milei has won decisive victories in the midterm elections, in an election where Donald Trump loomed large.

item.title: Fans miss Diljit Dosanjh's Western Sydney concert over 'hurtful' religious dagger ban
item.description: Concertgoers who had tickets to see an Indian music superstar have been offered a refund after refusing to leave their Sikh dagger at the gate.

item.title: 17-year-old boy charged with murder over stabbing near Hobart's Salamanca Place
item.description: A youth has been charged with murder after a 20-year-old man died in a stabbing near Hobart's Salamanca Place late on Saturday.

item.title: Neo-Nazi leader Thomas Sewell claims Ballarat rally was political but not offensive
item.description: Photos and videos shown to a Victorian court capture a racially charged speech given by Thomas Sewell before he leads a group of 30 masked men through Ballarat.

item.title: Police have charged a man for driving dangerously in Kununurra, with a video of the incident posted on Facebook.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Leaders in West Australia's far north believe a safe night place would help reduce youth crime
item.description: As juveniles in Kununurra continue to be arrested over car thefts, community leaders and the government are looking for solutions

item.title: Virginia Giuffre's brothers pledge to fight for justice
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: ACT 'beginning to see change' two years on from the introduction of drug decriminalisation laws
item.description: Advocates say since the ACT decriminalised "personal use" amounts of some illicit drugs, the territory has seen a shift toward meaningful harm reduction, but others are calling for those laws to be repealed, saying they are not working as intended.

item.title: Lithuania vows to shoot down Belarus smuggler balloons disrupting air traffic
item.description: Lithuania has drawn up plans to shut its border crossings with Belarus indefinitely, after the capital's airport was repeatedly disrupted by suspected sightings of balloons carrying contraband cigarettes.

item.title: Ten people face trial accused of cyberbullying French president's wife Brigitte Macron
item.description: Ten people to go on trial over cyberbullying of French President Emmanuel Macron's wife Brigitte Macron after they allegedly made "malicious" comments online spreading claims she is a man.

item.title: Donald Trump says he 'would love' third term but rules out running for vice-president in 2028
item.description: US President Donald Trump has ruled out running for vice-president in 2028, which some supporters have suggested could see him circumvent a constitutional bar against serving a third term.

item.title: Katy Perry and Justin Trudeau seen holding hands leaving Paris club
item.description: The pair's public appearance on the pop singer's 41st birthday has added fuel to growing speculation the two are in a relationship.

item.title: Knife-detecting wands not used by Tasmania Police on night of fatal stabbing near Salamanca
item.description: Tasmania Police confirms despite five knife-detecting wands being available, none were being used by officers in Hobart on the night of an alleged stabbing murder.

item.title: Top firefighters warn West Gate Tunnel not safe until proper checks completed
item.description: Victoria's emergency services are unprepared for critical incidents in Melbourne's soon-to-be-opened West Gate Tunnel, senior firefighters warn.

item.title: Is it cheaper to end poverty than to maintain it? Research says yes
item.description: In 2020, Australia massively increased welfare payments and conducted a live experiment in ending poverty, but when the subsidy was removed, many were thrown back into hardship. Leaving aside the moral dimension, would it be cheaper to end poverty than to maintain it?

item.title: Israeli families wait for release of remaining hostages in Gaza
item.description: The father of one of the dead hostages still in Gaza says he does not trust Hamas's assurances it is doing all it can to find and return the remains of Israelis.

item.title: On the dark web, paedophiles are sharing tips on how to abuse children in child care
item.description: Paedophiles are using the dark web to share information about how to gain access to childcare centres to sexually abuse babies and toddlers while avoiding getting caught.

item.title: Benjamin Netanyahu has rejected 'Bibi-sitting' claims but the US is watching Israel closely
item.description: Some of the most senior officials from the US arriving in Israel has prompted some to re-imagine the phrase "Bibi-sitting" — and question the motive behind it.

item.title: Netanyahu's 'Bibi-sitter' advertisement for 2015 Israeli election
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Russia's interest in Antarctic oil exposed after Ukrainian scientist's arrest
item.description: A document linked to the arrest of a scientist has raised questions about whether Russia has long-term ambitions to exploit oil resources in Antarctica, where mining is banned indefinitely.

item.title: Kids 'left in the dark' in family law matters, as Family Court of Australia makes new commitment
item.description: Sally's legal battle in the Federal Circuit and Family Court of Australia may be years long gone, but the trauma of the experience lingers — especially on her eldest child.

item.title: Labor has pivoted from health to housing. How will SA voters respond?
item.description: If Labor’s 2022 campaign was all about ambulance patients locked out of hospitals, then 2026 is all about young people locked out of home ownership.

item.title: Survivors of paedophile teacher Peter Farmer sue Victorian Education Department
item.description: Victims of a paedophile who used children's artwork to hide abuse are suing the Victorian Education Department, alleging his abuse should have been stopped earlier.

item.title: Queensland government drops special flood measures in Woolloongabba ahead of 2032 Olympics
item.description: Experts say changes by the Queensland government could ease construction costs by removing what the property industry describe as "unnecessary" restrictions, while residents could be left wearing the fallout.

item.title: Matildas to face England in Derby in first clash since Women's World Cup semi-final
item.description: Ella Toone's goal helped England break Australian hearts at the 2023 Women's World Cup. She knows, and Steph Catley admits, the Matildas are out for "revenge".

item.title: Why the RBA should put a handbrake on property prices
item.description: Whether or not we're delivered a rate cut next Tuesday, there's a solid argument that the RBA should once again consider using its powers to curb runaway real estate prices.

item.title: Hurricane Melissa could be strongest recorded storm to hit Jamaica
item.description: Having intensified into a category five system, Hurricane Melissa looks set to be the strongest hurricane to hit Jamaica since record-keeping began in 1851.

item.title: Alexei Popyrin loses to Alexander Bublik in Paris, before Australian snubbed for post-match handshake
item.description: Alexei Popyrin is knocked out of the Paris Masters, while the victorious Alexander Bublik walks off court without acknowledging the Australian.

item.title: Brain cancer patient's tumour growth halted after immunotherapy identified by molecular testing
item.description: Emma's brain tumour has stopped growing since she gained access to a type of immunotherapy identified by molecular testing.

item.title: WA Governor Chris Dawson to apologise to traditional owners for Pinjarra Massacre
item.description: The descendants of people who were murdered in one of Western Australia's most brutal attacks on Aboriginal people — the Pinjarra Massacre — are set to hear an apology from the WA governor.

item.title: Families of WWI soldiers will be reunited with century-old letters discovered on WA beach
item.description: Family members of two World War I soldiers have been left stunned after a bottle containing hand-written letters was found on a WA beach.

item.title: Angle Park Vet Clinic owners 'strongly dispute' claims of substandard care
item.description: Owners of an SA vet clinic say claims it provided substandard treatment to retired greyhounds, which the racing regulator allegedly ignored, "misrepresent" its procedures.

item.title: Athletes call for climate change action as Adapt2win campaign launched ahead of Cop30
item.description: Ahead of next month's COP30 in Brazil, sports stars from around the world have helped to launch a campaign urging for action on climate change.

item.title: Fears planned salt work expansion could threaten internationally significant wetlands
item.description: There are concerns plans to expand salt mining operations on a wetland that stretches from Carnarvon to the Ningaloo Coast could cause environmental damage.

item.title: Dutch volleyballer and convicted child rapist Steven van de Velde denied visa to enter Australia
item.description: Convicted Dutch child rapist Steven van de Velde has been denied a visa to Australia to compete in the Beach Volleyball World Championships.

item.title: WiseTech offices searched by AFP and ASIC over share trading allegations
item.description: WiseTech says it was required to produce documents related to alleged trading in WiseTech shares by controversial co-founder Richard White and three employees from late 2024 to early 2025.

item.title: Tasmanian couple takes on new adventure as caretakers of the Low Isles
item.description: Life as the caretaker of a tropical island includes gardening and plenty of birdwatching, but the job is not all glamorous.

item.title: Dogs filmed at wombat burrows in San Remo
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: San Remo wombats under threat from dogs and development, conservationists say
item.description: Conservationists say wombats on Victoria's Bass Coast are under threat from off-leash dogs that have been spotted entering their coastal burrows.

item.title: Massage therapist banned after sexually assaulting four clients in Orange
item.description: The Health Care Complaints Commission found the therapist would pose a "significant and unacceptable risk" to the public if he kept practising.

item.title: Plans to install cameras to capture moment Robe obelisk falls into the sea
item.description: A seaside landmark will be lost to the ocean, and the council is hoping to catch the moment on camera.

item.title: Google joins Microsoft in plans to restart US nuclear plants to power AI infrastructure
item.description: Google has announced a nuclear facility shuttered in 2020 will return to service in 2029 to help power its "growing cloud and AI infrastructure in Iowa", a year after Microsoft signed on to reopen Three Mile Island.

item.title: NSW government's drug summit response rejects medicinal cannabis defence for drivers for now
item.description: The government says it was "investigating" a medical defence for drivers prescribed cannabis but ruled out the use of sniffer dogs and strip searches for suspected drug possession at music festivals in its response to last year's drug summit.

item.title: Celtic manager Brendan Rodgers quits, leaving possible opening for Ange Postecoglou
item.description: Ange Postecoglou's name will inevitably be linked to a Celtic return after Brendan Rodgers resigns his post as manager of the struggling Scottish giants.

item.title: First NZYQ cohort member deported to Nauru under opaque deal potentially worth billions
item.description: Australia could end up paying the tiny island nation about $2.5 billion over three decades if the more than 350 former detainees are successfully resettled.

item.title: Venezuela accuses US of plotting false-flag operation in Caribbean
item.description: Venezuela says it has thwarted what it calls a CIA-linked plot to attack a US warship anchored in Trinidad.

item.title: School strikes in Tasmania's north-west as public sector workers walk off the job
item.description: Teachers, health workers and firefighters have walked off the job in Tasmania's north-west, with further stop-work action planned in other parts of the state over the next two days.

item.title: How the under-16s social media ban will impact teens with disabilities
item.description: Teens with disabilities say they might end up losing contact with friends and online communities due to being banned from social media.

item.title: Woman found dead on Great Barrier Reef's Lizard Island
item.description: Emergency services find an 80-year-old woman dead on a remote island in the Great Barrier Reef after she "failed to board" a cruise ship.

item.title: Suspect in Charlie Kirk killing can wear street clothes in court amid 'extraordinary' attention
item.description: A US judge has agreed Tyler Robinson's case has drawn "extraordinary" public and media attention.

item.title: Police call on public to help find missing car in Lonsdale murder investigation
item.description: Police say they are "very keen" to find a car believed to be the "missing piece of the jigsaw puzzle" as they investigate the death of father-of-two Chris Robertson.

item.title: Supreme Court in Brisbane overturns controversial freeze on puberty blockers for adolescents
item.description: Queensland controversially barred public doctors from prescribing puberty blockers to patients aged under 18 earlier this year.

item.title: Sydney Swans AFLW star Chloe Molloy to have season-ending back surgery
item.description: Sydney will be without co-captain Chloe Molloy for the rest of the AFLW season in a major setback as their finals hopes hang in the balance.

item.title: Woman charged with vandalism after gas services cut at Sutherland hospitals in Sydney
item.description: A 42-year-old woman has been charged after water and gas mains were cut at two hospitals in what the NSW health minister says could have been a "catastrophic" incident.

item.title: Australia to form part of Pacific 'taskforce' set to stir regional controversy
item.description: A group of Pacific nations created to respond to humanitarian catastrophes will have an expanded remit, including "stabilisation" missions.

item.title: Peter George, Greens lose faith in Rockliff government over promised Tasmanian salmon industry study
item.description: A strong critic of Tasmania's salmon industry says the Liberal government has "ambushed" those who supported it to remain in power.

item.title: Australia curlers Tahli Gill and Dean Hewitt face 2026 Winter Olympics qualification
item.description: Despite being set to take the world number one mixed-doubles ranking, Australian curling duo Tahli Gill and Dean Hewitt still face a major challenge in booking their spot at their second Winter Olympics.

item.title: Tom Trbojevic signs one-year contract extension with Manly Sea Eagles
item.description: Tom Trbojevic's contract saga with Manly is over after the superstar fullback agreed to a one-year deal that will keep him at the NRL club until the end of 2027.

item.title: Japan and US sign deal on rare earths as new Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi goes on 'charm offensive'
item.description: US President Donald Trump visits Japan and signs a framework agreement for securing the supply of critical minerals and rare earths through mining and processing with Japan Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi.

item.title: Hannah McGuire's killer Lachlan Young stares blankly during minute's silence in the Supreme Court
item.description: In a rarely-seen move, a Victorian judge halts proceedings in the Supreme Court to hold a minute's silence for a domestic violence murder victim.

item.title: Man jailed for paying teen for sex and intimate images in the Kimberley
item.description: A 44-year-old man is sentenced after paying a teenage girl he met online for sex and distributing intimate images of her without her knowledge.

item.title: Senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price accused of 'using her position' to defame Central Land Council boss
item.description: Jacinta Nampijinpa Price has been accused of "using her position" to "promote" false claims about Central Land Council chief executive Lesley Turner, on the final day of her civil defamation trial.

item.title: Farm owner cleared of all charges over worker's electrocution
item.description: The owner of a pineapple farm charged over the death of a 25-year-old worker has successfully appealed his conviction.

item.title: NRL stands down South Sydney Rabbitohs winger Tyrone Munro
item.description: South Sydney's Tyrone Munro faces being sidelined for at least the start of next season, after being stood down by the NRL while facing domestic violence charges.

item.title: A higher-than-expected inflation figure would put the Reserve Bank in quite a spot
item.description: If the September quarter consumer price index comes in higher than expected, it could postpone home loan relief for borrowers and create a dilemma for the RBA.

item.title: Nicole Kidman, Baz Lurhmann open Vogue World in tribute to old Hollywood glamour
item.description: From a Nicole Kidman "revenge" dress to a dressing-gown tuxedo, these are all of the best Hollywood-style looks at this year's Vogue World event.

item.title: What loving someone with an addiction or dependence can look like
item.description: An expert says it can be lonely caring for or supporting someone living with a dependence or addiction.

item.title: Magistrate finds Neo-Nazi leader Thomas Sewell not guilty of offensive behaviour over Ballarat rally
item.description: A Victorian Magistrate says he has not been convinced that Thomas Sewell's behaviour during a 2023 Neo-Nazi rally in Ballarat was offensive.

item.title: Minister defends cost blowout for new eight-bed hospital in outback WA
item.description: John Carey has defended a decision to press on with the construction of a new eight-bed hospital in outback WA after costs blew out to $63.6 million.

item.title: WA Governor Chris Dawson apologises to descendants of Pinjarra Massacre, almost 200 years later
item.description: Gathering on sacred land where their ancestors were slain in one of the most brutal attacks on Aboriginal people in Western Australia, Traditional Owners hear the word it took almost 200 years to say — "sorry".

item.title: Queensland government criticises timing of changes to Bureau of Meteorology website in aftermath of storm
item.description: On Sunday, south-east Queensland was lashed by a severe thunderstorm, which left thousands still without power. The state government says the timing of upgrades to BOM's website was "not good enough".

item.title: Australia wicketkeeper Alex Carey at peace with Ashes stumping infamy
item.description: Australia wicketkeeper Alex Carey says he wants to be part of more Ashes history, after being central to one of the most infamous moments during the previous series.

item.title: Australians with oral cancer forced to drain super or remortgage homes to pay for dental prosthetics because of funding gap
item.description: Australians with oral cancer are being left tens of thousands of dollars out of pocket to cover dental prosthetics because of a gap in funding.

item.title: Australia Diamonds captain Liz Watson confident New Zealand losing run can end in fourth Test of Constellation Cup
item.description: The Diamonds are "trusting the process" as they prepare for the Constellation Cup-deciding netball clash against the Silver Ferns in Christchurch.

item.title: Queensland man Za'id Abdus Samad sentenced over 2018 terror charges, weeks after murder conviction
item.description: Za'id Adbus Samad has been sentenced to six years imprisonment over terrorism charges less than a month after being handed a life sentence for the murder of his uncle.

item.title: World Series 2025: LA Dodgers win game three, Shohei Ohtani 119-year first, Freddie Freeman home run
item.description: Los Angeles Dodgers' star Shohei Ohtani has completed one of the greatest individual performances in the World Series game.

item.title: Japan's Shinzo Abe assassin pleads guilty in court
item.description: A man accused of killing Japan's former prime minister Shinzo Abe has pleaded guilty, three years after the assassination in broad daylight shocked the world.

item.title: Leaders pinpoint solutions needed to end Kununurra youth crime
item.description: Frustrated community leaders in Kununurra say overcrowded, unsafe housing and short-term staff contracts are contributing to a youth crime problem in the Western Australian town.

item.title: SA Museum investigates whether meteorite collided with car on regional highway
item.description: Andrew Melville-Smith was left covered in glass when an unidentified object smashed into his windscreen — and now scientists are investigating whether it was a meteorite.

item.title: Humpback whale found dead tangled in shark net at Coledale north of Wollongong
item.description: The discovery of a dead whale entangled in a shark net off Coledale Beach ignites fresh debate on New South Wales's controversial shark net program.

item.title: Stolen guns are fuelling Australia’s surge in illegal firearms
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Job cuts inevitable as BHP scales back Pilbara iron ore mine
item.description: A mining giant says its long-running Yandi iron ore mine in the Pilbara will be significantly scaled back next year.

item.title: Australians with oral cancer helped by 3D printing
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Louvre heist – How did they got away with it?
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Bail revoked for teens accused of man's stabbing murder at Shellharbour
item.description: Four teenagers accused of luring a 25-year-old man to a Shellharbour train station and stabbing him to death are taken into custody after their bail is revoked.

item.title: Sheffield Shield round 3: Jake Weatherald out for a duck, no play at the Gabba on day 1
item.description: Rain in Brisbane washes out the first day of play in the Sheffield Shield match between Queensland and New South Wales.

item.title: 'Storm hunters' fly through eye of Hurricane Melissa as Jamaica braces for impact
item.description: A US Air Force squad known as the Hurricane Hunters has flown through the eye of Hurricane Melissa, which is packing winds of 282 kilometres per hour as it moves slowly towards southern Jamaica.

item.title: New AFP taskforce to target men 'hunting' young girls and coercing them into violent acts
item.description: In an address to the National Press Club on Wednesday, new AFP Commissioner Krissy Barrett will announce the new taskforce and flag a desire to recast the agency as a national security agency.

item.title: Bluey composer and Megan Washington among winners at 2025 Screen Music Awards
item.description: Bluey composer Joff Bush, Megan Washington and the music for Tony Armstrong's Eat the Invaders were among the winners at the 2025 Screen Music Awards.

item.title: Global climate plans need urgent acceleration to meet 2035 emissions target, UN report finds
item.description: A report from the UN's climate change body shows global carbon emissions appear to be on track to fall by 10 per cent by 2035, far short of its 60 per cent target.

item.title: Fawlty Towers actress Prunella Scales dies age 93
item.description: British actress Prunella Scales, best known for playing Sybil Fawlty in beloved sitcom Fawlty Towers, has died age 93.

item.title: Amazon cuts 14,000 jobs as it ramps up AI push
item.description: The company is committing billions on data centre projects in the US as it tries to keep up with other tech giants making leaps in AI.

item.title: Elon Musk launches new AI-generated site Grokipedia to rival 'left-biased' Wikipedia
item.description: Billionaire Elon Musk has launched a new AI-generated site to compete with online encyclopedia Wikipedia, which he has accused of being "extremely left-biased".

item.title: Sudan paramilitary group accused of killing 2,000 civilians in El-Fasher
item.description: Sudanese paramilitary forces are accused of having "executed more than 2,000 unarmed civilians" since taking control of the western city of El-Fasher, as alarming reports of atrocities emerge.

item.title: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu orders 'powerful' strikes in Gaza
item.description: Gaza health officials say the Israeli strikes have killed at least 26 people, including four in Gaza City's Sabra neighbourhood and five in a car in Khan Younis.

item.title: England dominate Matildas, win 3-0 in international friendly at Pride Park after Alanna Kennedy sent off
item.description: The Matildas were criticised for playing at "walking pace" as two-time European champions England dominate at Derby's Pride Park.

item.title: Health minister reinstates ban on puberty blockers hours after Supreme Court overturned freeze
item.description: The Queensland health minister has issued a new directive to ban public doctors from prescribing puberty blockers to youths six hours after a Supreme Court overturned the January freeze.

item.title: Watt defends intervention powers, saying it will not be used to fast track coal and gas
item.description: Murray Watt warns the Coalition and Greens not to "obstruct" environment laws being introduced to parliament on Thursday, while assuring a special power in the bill would not allow him to intervene on behalf of coal or gas projects.

item.title: Experts predict lengthy investigation into Cobar underground mine explosion that killed two people
item.description: A leading Australian expert in mining safety says the investigation into a fatal explosion at a western New South Wales mine could take a long time because "mining is getting more complex".

item.title: Kamala Harris reveals regret over 'reckless' decision ahead of US election
item.description: Former US vice-president Kamala Harris reveals she is contemplating another run for the presidency and says she was "reckless" to not stop Joe Biden from pursuing a second term.

item.title: Optus to be called before senators on Monday to explain triple-0 failure
item.description: An inquiry into the telco's triple-0 failure was green-lit by the Senate late on Tuesday and will hold its first hearings in Parliament House next week.

item.title: When is your tax return due in Australia? Here's what you need to know
item.description: Time is running out if you are planning on doing your 2024–25 tax return yourself. Here is everything you need to know.

item.title: Pacific leader pushing Australia to 'close the deal' on hosting COP31
item.description: One the Pacific's most high-profile leaders is pressing Anthony Albanese to fly to the global UN climate summit in Brazil next month to "close the deal" with Türkiye and secure COP31 hosting rights for next year.

item.title: US private credit provider White Oak eyeing off Tasmania's troubled Liberty Bell Bay smelter
item.description: As a pause in production at troubled smelter Liberty Bell Bay stretches on, speculation about its future builds after a series of meetings between a US private credit provider and Tasmania's industry minister.

item.title: Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim discusses Donald Trump, China and Gaza
item.description: The South-East Asian nation has been in the spotlight this week after hosting the ASEAN summit, which was attended by Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and US President Donald Trump.

item.title: Safety authority investigates how cruise ship left woman's body on Lizard Island
item.description: The Australian Maritime Safety Authority will speak with the crew of a cruise ship that allegedly left behind an 80-year-old Australian woman, who was later found dead on a Queensland tropical island.

item.title: Hurricane Melissa barrels towards Jamaica
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Musicians react to 'random' City of Sydney busking limits in CBD
item.description: Busking may be a familiar sight on Sydney's George Street, but most key spots for musicians have now been banned.

item.title: Construction delays on SA's three biggest hospital projects, auditor-general says
item.description: The South Australian government's three costliest hospital projects have all had "delays in starting construction", according to the auditor-general — but the health minister says they remain on schedule.

item.title: Fears Lake Boga algae bloom will impact summer tourism
item.description: Blue-green algae levels at Lake Boga in Victoria's north-west are three times the safe limit.

item.title: Inflation comes in hotter than forecast, sending ASX tumbling and Aussie dollar higher — as it happened
item.description: The Australian share market tumbled and the Aussie dollar gained ground, as hotter-than-expected inflation dialled back interest rate cut expectations. Commonwealth Bank economists are among those now expecting no further rate cuts this cycle.

item.title: Kangaroos name Harry Grant as captain for second Ashes Test to replace Isaah Yeo
item.description: Harry Grant is handed the captaincy of a major representative team for the first time as he is named to lead the Kangaroos in the second Ashes Test.

item.title: Taxpayer-funded cybersecurity course with 80pc dropout rate and recruitment issues labelled a 'patch job'
item.description: An 80 per cent dropout rate, compliance concerns, and a LEGO city sold as a "highlight" — this multimillion-dollar cybersecurity initiative has been labelled a "patch job".

item.title: Tasman Bridge barrier concept designs released ahead of works to address safety concerns
item.description: Plans to widen the pedestrian and cycling pathways on Hobart's Tasman Bridge were scrapped last year, but improved safety barriers and passing bays will go ahead.

item.title: Federal government investigates Inpex's Darwin oil spill, emissions error
item.description: An oil spill that leaked into Darwin Harbour and the substantial under-reporting of toxic emissions have put one of Australia's biggest gas companies under federal investigation.

item.title: PM should consider his attire with 'great care': Bragg on Albanese's t-shirt
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Victorian traditional owner group calls for pause on mining approvals
item.description: The Federation of Victorian Traditional Owner Corporations calls for a pause on mining approvals until a formal benefit-sharing agreement is in place.

item.title: India confirms Shreyas Iyer recovering in hospital with lacerated spleen from ODI incident
item.description: The Indian team confirms Shreyas Iyer is on the mend after a freak injury left him in hospital with a lacerated spleen in an incident during his side's ODI win over Australia.

item.title: Governor's apology over Pinjarra Massacre renews debate over stripping Stirling name from WA landmarks
item.description: The WA governor's apology for the Pinjarra Massacre sparks fresh debate over the renaming of roads and places that honour the state's first governor, James Stirling.

item.title: ABC taken into Gaza area under IDF control for first time since ceasefire
item.description: For the first time since the ceasefire started, the ABC has gained access to an area in northern Gaza under Israeli military control. This is what we could see from behind the Yellow Line.

item.title: Study finds adverse links between PFAS exposure and reproductive health in mice
item.description: A study using mice has found high exposure to PFAS lowered the male's sperm count, decreased testosterone and disrupted embryo development.

item.title: Experts concerned about WA's anti-vape laws as 'candy store' allegedly sells products near schools
item.description: Parents and regional business owners say they are concerned about the proliferation of illegal vapes making their way into the country despite repeatedly alerting authorities.

item.title: Hurricane Melissa makes landfall, destroys homes as Jamaica's strongest-ever storm
item.description: Hurricane Melissa made landfall in western Jamaica as a powerful category five storm and the strongest ever to directly hit the Caribbean nation of 2.8 million people.

item.title: State Administrative Tribunal upholds donkey cull notice at remote Kachana Station in the Kimberley
item.description: The State Administrative Tribunal rejects an application to review a DPIRD order to cull more than 100 feral donkeys at a remote Kimberley station.

item.title: Kai Trump, granddaughter of US President Donald Trump, invited to play in LPGA Tour event
item.description: Kai Trump receives an invitation to play in a tournament in Florida ahead of starting her collegiate golf career.

item.title: The key role a 'lost' reef is playing in South Australia's algal bloom fight
item.description: A marine ecologist's discovery two years ago sparked a restoration project and has become a key element in South Australia's response to a devastating algal bloom.

item.title: ‘Storm of the century’ hits Jamaica and heads towards Cuba
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Bureau of Meteorology ordered to fix new website after torrent of complaints
item.description: Environment Minister Murray Watt tells the Bureau of Meteorology that its new $4.1 million website needs to be fixed after complaints from users.

item.title: Powerhouse seeks ideas for 100-year time capsule to be buried at Parramatta site opening
item.description: The Powerhouse Museum buried technologies such as a solar calculator and cardboard box camera in 1981. Now they want to know what to bury in 2026.

item.title: Man's death at a Sutherland hospital under investigation after alleged vandalism
item.description: A man's death at a Sydney hospital that had its lines to medical gases cut off on Tuesday is now being investigated by police and referred to the state coroner.

item.title: Dubbo's Carol Mudford wins AgriFutures Rural Women's Award
item.description: Carol Mudford's grassroots charity, sHedway, is dedicated to suicide prevention and positive mental health in the shearing industry.

item.title: At least 64 killed in Rio de Janeiro police operation ahead of COP30 events
item.description: More than 60 people have been killed in Rio de Janeiro's deadliest police operation, staged in the lead-up to the city hosting COP30 summit events.

item.title: World-first preterm birth prevention program has lowered the rate of early births by about 4,000 a year
item.description: A program introduced in Australia in 2018 has led to thousands of fewer babies born early each year, according to a new study.

item.title: Dicky Beach holiday park residents angry after Sunshine Coast Council decision
item.description: More than 100 residents face an uncertain future after a Queensland council votes to end permanent residencies at a holiday park.

item.title: Workers stood down from GFG Alliance Tahmoor coal mine expect hard times
item.description: Half the workforce at the Tahmoor Colliery in NSW has been stood down without pay, with workers and their families facing weeks of financial uncertainty.

item.title: Nine Queensland high schools taught wrong topic for external ancient history exam
item.description: Queensland's education minister has put authorities on notice after nine high schools taught year 12 students the wrong topic for today's ancient history exam.

item.title: Darwin wakes to shaking from magnitude-6.4 earthquake in Banda Sea
item.description: People across the Northern Territory's Top End woke to shaking in the early hours during a magnitude-6.4 earthquake in the Banda Sea near Timor-Leste.

item.title: Indoor cricket to no longer receive operational and financial support from Cricket Australia
item.description: Cricket Australia has conceded it has an "unsustainable" cost base, after cutting operational and financial support for indoor cricket and leaving the sport to manage itself.

item.title: Hughenden locals fed up with water quality as CopperString project looms
item.description: Hughenden business owner Jodie Coward says she has not drank water straight from the tap in two years.

item.title: Australian captain Pat Cummins begins return to bowling with limited net session in Sydney
item.description: Australia's Test captain Pat Cummins completes a brief return to bowling as he steps up his bid to play in the Ashes series against England.

item.title: Annual inflation surges to 3.2pc in September quarter, up from 2.1pc in June
item.description: Inflation data has came in much hotter than economists were expecting with annual inflation surging to 3.2 per cent in the September quarter, up from 2.1pc in June.

item.title: AVO application against Mark Latham likely to be 'resolved', ex-partner's lawyer tells court
item.description: An apprehended violence order application against MP Mark Latham is "very much likely" to be resolved but remains ongoing, his former partner's lawyer has told a court.

item.title: 14 people killed as US carries out strikes on four more alleged drug boats
item.description: Mexican authorities are searching for a lone survivor seen clinging to wreckage following the strikes in the eastern Pacific Ocean.

item.title: John Cleese leads tributes to 'perfect' on-screen wife Prunella Scales
item.description: Prunella Scales has been remembered as part of the golden era of British comedy for her numerous roles across film, TV and theatre.

item.title: Committal hearing begins for Perry Kouroumblis over 1977 Easey St murders
item.description: DNA evidence could make or break Melbourne’s Easey Street cold case, a court has heard, with the prime suspect denying any involvement in the double murder.

item.title: Vietnam tourist sites submerged as record rainfall causes major flooding
item.description: Heavy rains cause major flooding in central Vietnam, while a category five hurricane rages on the other side of the world in the Caribbean.

item.title: Sheffield Shield: Steve Smith scores timely century ahead of Ashes as Sam Konstas, Cam Green and Beau Webster fail to fire
item.description: Steve Smith makes a triumphant return to New South Wales's Sheffield Shield side but his fellow Australian Test players don't have the same impact as they look to secure their Ashes spots.

item.title: Bathurst childcare worker pleads guilty to recklessly wounding four-year-old
item.description: A NSW childcare worker has pleaded guilty to recklessly wounding the boy, who sustained a 2cm laceration when she tried to put him down for a rest.

item.title: Matildas launch fierce defence of Sam Kerr amid criticism of captaincy call
item.description: Sam Kerr's coach and teammates aren't second-guessing the decision to re-install her as Matildas captain after returning to the field following a lengthy lay-off.

item.title: Police call for information about man seen talking to Collie schoolgirl Lisa Mott
item.description: Lisa Mott, 12, was last seen in the WA town of Collie almost 45 years ago. Now, police say a witness claims he saw her talking to a man leaning on a yellow panel van.

item.title: George Orwell's Animal Farm gets AI makeover as students learn about online influence
item.description: George Orwell's Animal Farm is being used to help high schoolers identify how AI can be used to influence opinion, build power and shape narratives.

item.title: Liberal MPs question Sussan Ley's attack on Albanese's Joy Division shirt
item.description: Sussan Ley stands by her criticism of the prime minister for wearing a Joy Division T-shirt while stepping off a plane last week. Privately, some of her Liberal colleagues are questioning the attack.

item.title: Inflation data kills November rate cut chances as RBA faces headache
item.description: A November rate cut is dead, buried and cremated. It now looks far from certain that interest rates will fall again at all.

item.title: AFL confirms arrival of last disposal rule as one of seven changes for 2026 season
item.description: The AFL confirms the arrival of the last disposal rule as one of seven rule changes aimed at making umpires' jobs easier while shortening the length of games.

item.title: Algerian oak facing removal for transmission lines wins Tree of the Year
item.description: Residents of a small Victorian town hope a Tree of the Year award will save a beloved Algerian oak from being chopped down to make way for transmission lines.

item.title: Dozens arrested in Operation Ironside sting across South Australia
item.description: More than 50 people have been arrested and charged with more than 800 offences in a major Operation Ironside sting across South Australia linked to the encrypted AN0M app.

item.title: Gareth Ward sentencing delayed due to legal dispute over criminal offence rules
item.description: The sentencing of former NSW Liberal minister Gareth Ward is postponed while the court considers which set of sentencing rules applies to his offences.

item.title: Broken Hill resident sick of thieves stealing Slag Street sign
item.description: Broken Hill resident Sid Siddall worries a lack of signage could result in emergency services being unable to find him the next time he needs urgent help.

item.title: Lily Allen's West End Girl strikes a chord with other artists turning break-ups into art
item.description: Lily Allen has dropped her first album in seven years and it is... revealing. We asked Australian artists about turning pain into power, and why break-up songs resonate so deeply with fans.

item.title: Tasmanian politicians meet with AFL over contentious Hobart stadium proposal
item.description: A group of Tasmanian politicians opposed to the proposed Hobart stadium has failed to convince the AFL to abandon the contentious project during a meeting in Melbourne.

item.title: Former police officer killed in hit and run at Ulmarra showground
item.description: A former police officer has been killed in a hit and run while walking her dogs in Ulmarra on the New South Wales north coast.

item.title: NT Aboriginal land councils accuse federal government of failing to consult on environmental legislation reform
item.description: Bodies representing remote Indigenous Australians have warned that communities are becoming uninhabitable, as they push the federal government to strengthen proposed environmental reforms.

item.title: How this is 'easily the most competitive season' of AFLW outside of North Melbourne
item.description: The final round of the AFLW home and away season promises to be nervous watching for more than half the competition's fans as eleven sides battle for seven finals spots up for grabs.

item.title: 'Fake' Australian admiral found living in suburban Perth a year after vanishing
item.description: Peter Cowell's whereabouts have been unknown since July 2024, but the ABC has tracked him down to suburban Perth.

item.title: David Fifita reunites with Wayne Bennett at South Sydney Rabbitohs, ending five-season stint at Gold Coast Titans
item.description: After flirting with exits from the Titans previously, David Fifita makes his move official, joining the South Sydney Rabbitohs on a deal for the next two seasons.

item.title: How Hurricane Melissa was supercharged by hot oceans in the Caribbean
item.description: Dubbed the "storm of the century", Hurricane Melissa shook off three different meteorological conditions that normally weaken major hurricanes.

item.title: Canberra father accused of threatening daughter with axe outside school granted bail
item.description: The man is warned that he came close to being remanded in custody, with the magistrate saying he is on a "knife-edge".

item.title: Corrective Services Minister says some children accused of Kununurra crime spree 'belong in detention'
item.description: Children accused of being involved in a crime spree in Western Australia's north "belong in detention", the state's Corrective Services Minister says.

item.title: Suspected human remains found one week after Darling Downs man charged with murder
item.description: Police divers, cadaver dogs and SES have been searching a property at Cressbrook Creek, north of Toowoomba, as they investigate the alleged murder of Paul Woods.

item.title: Canberra man jailed over the theft of Virgin van he drove around Canberra Airport's tarmac
item.description: A man who drove through the airport's perimeter fence three times in 2023 has been sentenced in the ACT Supreme Court.

item.title: Man jailed for ramming car through gates of Russian consulate in Sydney
item.description: Confronting body-worn footage showing the incident was played in court during the sentencing of 40-year-old Rimi Abraham.

item.title: Cruise tragedy sparks calls for tighter maritime safety rules on Great Barrier Reef
item.description: The death of an 80-year-old woman who was left on a remote tropical island after a cruise stop has reignited debate over passenger safety standards on the Great Barrier Reef.

item.title: Wednesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Jesse Wahlen Beale, accused of killing partner Crystal Beale, and dumping body, denied bail
item.description: Court hears Jesse Wahlen Beale, who is accused of killing his partner Crystal Beale before dumping her body, made Google searches about river tidal movements and CCTV cameras around the time of her death.

item.title: Former Australian Signals Directorate employee accused of selling trade secrets to Russia by US prosecutors
item.description: The man, who has been accused by the US of selling secrets to Russia, worked for the Australian Signals Directorate, the national agency responsible for cyber security and foreign signals intelligence.

item.title: Rain washes out first T20, with India on top of Aussies
item.description: India have been left frustrated after rain washed out the Twenty20 series opener against Australia at a cold and dreary Manuka Oval.

item.title: Fake money found at SA home prompts two arrests, police say
item.description: South Australian police charge two people with deception after they allegedly found more than 30 counterfeit notes — as well as an imitation firearm and a machete — at a home on Yorke Peninsula.

item.title: Attempted murder trial of man who stabbed Australian girl in London dropped on psychiatric grounds
item.description: UK authorities drop attempted murder trial against a man who stabbed an 11-year-old Australian girl in London in August 2024 on psychiatric grounds.

item.title: Anthony Albanese joins Donald Trump and other leaders for dinner on sidelines of APEC summit
item.description: A select group of world leaders have dined with United States President Donald Trump in South Korea, including Prime Minister Anthony Albanese.

item.title: Australian Diamonds defeat Silver Ferns to claim Constellation Cup in extra-time thriller
item.description: The Diamonds' trophy cabinet is again complete after they snapped their New Zealand drought against the Silver Ferns in a thrilling extra time period to bring the Constellation Cup back to Australia.

item.title: WOMADelaide 2026 first line-up announced: full list of artists and dates
item.description: Icons, innovators, and unexpected gems — WOMADelaide's 2026 line-up promises a truly unique festival experience.

item.title: Israeli air strikes kill 104 in Gaza, Trump insists ceasefire will hold
item.description: The Israeli military said it would abide by a ceasefire accord in Gaza, as health officials in the enclave said IDF air strikes had killed 104 people.

item.title: Russia bombs Ukrainian children's hospital as Vance says war will end 'eventually'
item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says the attack shows that Russia is the "largest terrorist organisation in the world".

item.title: Hurricane Melissa leaves trail of devastation in Jamaica as 'storm of the century' barrels into Cuba
item.description: Authorities say 77 per cent of the country is without power after the category five "storm of the century" barrelled through on Tuesday.
